content: eight crafters welcome to another edition of I show you my stuff where I
kind of do the reverse I'll show you what I made and I talked a little bit
about how I made it if you're interested so in this episode I want to show you
this royal carpet I made I really wanted to give some kind of detail to this
throne room to make it you know seem regal and the throne room is so drab
itself you know it come into disrepair if it was dirty and you know crumbling
pillars so I really wanted to add a shock of color to this to really make it
dynamic and let's go to the table I'll show you what I came up with I show you
my stuff with DM Scotty we zoom in here to the throne room we have the large
double doors then I go over those and we see the really neat carpet that I
featured and here we go we zoom in until lady covered with the white veil so here
we go here's the tile all in all its glory the double doors open and our
adventurers come in and you can see how that carpet really gives a nice touch of
color to this otherwise drab room I really like that since this is a throne
room we have my lady with the veil I think it's really creepy looking I just
put a piece of tissue over that with soaked in white glue and that's all I
did to make that veil so the guys move in it's very dark in here and then some
zombies start coming out of the shadows as they were either laying on the ground
or hidden in the shadows and start crawling out from the edges of the room
so yeah the party is kind of in a pickle now so but yeah more zombies crawling
from out from every crevice in the room so ah as a lot of zombies alright so
there's the scene one cool thing though is this dragon throne which I did a
video on you can watch that it slides forward and I have a secret passage that
the players can take if they find the right way to unlatch it so that's kind
of neat and so they can go down there they can flee the scene if they wanted
so that's kind of neat that kind of neat feature to this tile and there you go
here I'll show you the dragon throne so yeah if you remember I did a video on
this and I'll do the link here for you and so that's my throne room with the
carpet to start out the carpet I just used a regular piece of paper and
measured out two and a quarter inch wide and then drew the strip all the way down
the to the end of the paper and then I painted it on with a royal purple and I
used a I watered it down so it'd be kind of splotchy which is an old carpet so I
wanted to look that way anyway now after I got this painted and dried I painted
white lines along the edge with just white and then some details in the
corner and the edges and then my next task I wanted to give a royal symbol so
I painted this dragon with a thin brush in white just right in the center of the
carpet there and I wanted to stress it it's an old carpet so I put some black
on the edges I also cut a few pieces out of the center there and then put some
black around the edge to look like it was distraught and I thought that came
out really nicely now here it is I've cut the carpet out of the paper itself
and I distressed the edge as you can see there that's really nice and I had a
couple choices I could put this on a card stock and put it on the tile but I
decided just to glue it right to the tile so here's the tile itself and I
just glued it right down leading right up to the throne hey guys I really hope
you liked this episode simple but dynamic technique if you like this
kind of crafting make sure to check out my forum and Facebook page a great group
of people also I have lots and lots and lots of videos over 300 now so if you're
looking for some subject on wargaming or RPG you're probably going to find it
here so check out my other videos and until next time go forth and craft
